title: Owner of Flora in talks to gobble up vegan cheese maker Violife for €500m
text:
Upfield, the owner of Flora, Stork, and I Can’t Believe It’s Not Butter brands, is in talks to acquire Violife Foods for €500m (£449m), in a bid to tap into growing global consumer demand for non-dairy food products.

The former Unilever business, now owned by private equity firm KKR since late 2017, is the leading bidder out of a number of companies to takeover the vegan cheese maker, as first reported by Sky News.

The tabled bid will create one of the biggest manufacturers of plant-based foods in the world and is thought to be worth around €500, which other buyout firms have failed to match.
